title: Understanding Data Joins
text: A data join method is used to combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column between them.

title: Types of Data Joins
text: Common types of data joins include Inner Join, Left Join, Right Join, and Full Outer Join.

title: Inner Join
text: An Inner Join returns only the rows where there is a match in both tables.

title: Left Join
text: A Left Join returns all rows from the left table and the matched rows from the right table. If there is no match, the result is NULL from the right side.

title: Right Join
text: A Right Join returns all rows from the right table and the matched rows from the left table. If there is no match, the result is NULL from the left side.

title: Full Outer Join
text: An outer join keeps the records from both of the tables. If there is no corresponding value, the "full" indicates that it will be filled.
